page.title: 11B.B.C. RADIO SHROPSHIRE.
page.content: {B.B.C.Radio Shropshire}was set up in 1985. Test transmissions began on Monday 25th March, with the first official broadcast on St.Georges Day,23rd April,with{Dianne Kemp's Breakfast Show.It was officially opened on June 12th by{Stuart Young, the{Chairman of the B.B.C. The station serves the whole of Shropshire (population 380,000) and parts of the neighbouring counties with an initial annual budget of half a million pounds.It has a BBC staff of 27; 23 in{Shrewsbury,}3 in{Telford}and 1 in{Bridgnorth,}with 6 presenters and 9 news reporters/producers. The main V.H.F.transmitter (96m)is on{The Wrekin,}with the medium wave(397m,756kHz) at{Nobold {Lane,}and 2 other transmitters for the south of the county at{Ludlow.
